definition[0]: an amount of money that you have not spent, or an amount of something that you have not used
example[0]: The new engines will lead to savings in fuel.
example[1]: All small companies will need to make savings if they are to survive.
definition[1]: when you save money rather than spend it
definition[2]: the act of keeping money to use later rather than spending it
example[3]: We want to encourage saving and investment.
definition[3]: an amount of something that you have not used or spent, especially compared with a larger amount that you could have used or spent
example[4]: This amount represents a considerable saving over last year’s expenditure.
example[5]: Recent pension-plan changes will make a saving of $400 million next year.
definition[4]: money that is kept in a bank to be used later or invested, rather than spent
example[6]: Investors lost their life savings (=all the money they had saved during their life) when the bank collapsed.
definition[5]: when total income in the economy is more than the total amount spent on goods
